title: Sans Serif, pointed and rounded
content:
This logo was created by an intern who then did as all interns do...left without providing native files to us! Any ideas are really helpful in identifying it so that we can add some content and maintain our brand. Thanks for any help! See text here:

[http://sustainability.uga.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/curc-text.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415144129/http:/sustainability.uga.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/curc-text.jpg "http://sustainability.uga.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/curc-text.jpg")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [curc-text.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415144129/http:/typophile.com/files/curc-text.jpg) | 69.46 KB |
author: alentini

comments.content:
Appears to be a freemium font called Moderna, with a few additions or modifications (&, Y):  
 [http://www.dafont.com/moderna.font?text=COLLEGE+%26+UNIVERSTIY+RECYCLING...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415144129/http:/www.dafont.com/moderna.font?text=COLLEGE+%26+UNIVERSTIY+RECYCLING+COALITION "http://www.dafont.com/moderna.font?text=COLLEGE+%26+UNIVERSTIY+RECYCLING+COALITION")
Thanks, Riccardo. Dafont wasn’t rendering the ampersand....
